content: Overpriced products that have significantly dropped in qualityCoca-Cola is no longer carbonated enough and so goes flat when it's only been open a short amount of time. It's worse with the plastic bottles but still an issue with the cans. I used to drink a lot of Coke but now it always goes flat before I finish a bottle, or even a can. Lowering the quality but increasing the price to extortionate amounts is unethical and as the customer, you feel ripped off. Also the big bottles are now clearly made cheaply and are now flimsy, make them easier to spill when pouring, especially for people with motor issues. The new caps are a nightmare to get back on, again especially for disabled people but even for those without issues with their grip. Date of experience: November 25, 2024

When Coca-Cola travels for business they‚Äôre too big for their britchesI used to enjoy their products, however I worked for a hotel and people from Coca-Cola came to stay for business. From walking in the door to departure, they were extremely rude including the vice president. They acted like they rented out the entire hotel instead of a few rooms. They felt entitled to request things get moved around in the communal areas multiple times and made a list for the general manager. For example, we had a Coca-Cola fridge (the hotel owns it) and they wanted us to change out the drinks displayed in there since they weren‚Äôt all Coca-Cola brand. They demanded we only hand out their branded water and have them in all the rooms during their stay (and not just their rooms. All of them!). The vice president also felt the need to violate our property rules. His assistant yelled at the security officer for doing their job asking him not to smoke his cigar in the courtyard (he insisted on doing this nightly). The next week we had a different soda brand come in for business and they did not act this way. They acted normal. Coca-Cola forgot that while they were there, they were acting under their brand. As a consumer, I have been vocal about their behavior and will support any other soda company. Date of experience is rough estimate. Date of experience: January 01, 2024

Coca-ColaCoca-Cola, the world's most recognizable brand, is a prime example of how misleading marketing can mask a product's harmful effects. While it may offer a temporary burst of sweet satisfaction, the long-term consequences of its consumption are far from pleasant.Here's why you should think twice before reaching for that cold can of Coca-Cola:Sugar Bomb: A single can of Coca-Cola packs a shocking amount of added sugar, contributing to obesity, type 2 diabetes, and heart disease.Tooth Decay Nightmare: The high sugar content and acidic nature of Coca-Cola wreak havoc on your teeth, leading to cavities, erosion, and weakened enamel.Dehydration Danger: Despite its liquid form, Coca-Cola can actually dehydrate your body due to its diuretic effect.Empty Calories: Coca-Cola provides little to no nutritional value, leaving you feeling hungry and unsatisfied.Addiction Potential: The combination of sugar and caffeine in Coca-Cola can be addictive, making it difficult to break free from its grip.In conclusion, while Coca-Cola may be a nostalgic favorite for many, it's time to recognize its negative impact on our health. Opt for healthier alternatives like water, herbal tea, or fresh fruit juice to nourish your body and protect your future.Date of experience: September 11, 2024

STOP BUYINGI am sick to death of being ripped off with your massively overpriced packs of Coca Cola that longer have any fizz, after decades of drinking coke your product has got so bad I won‚Äôt be buying again. Shame on you! Date of experience: November 18, 2024

Coca Cola's Rat problem‚Ä¶I contacted Coca Cola with a product quality issue, regarding Rat infestation affecting High Fructose Corn Syrup in their products. I presented proof of these facts to Coca Cola's management team. Coca Cola blew off the quality issue as if it does not exist. High Fructose Corn Syrup made from corn stored in Rat infested corn silos. The rats defecate and urinate on the corn. The conveyors that move the corn, often mutilate the rat's bodies, leaving their blood, body organs, skin, hair, urine, and feces in with the corn that gets made into High Fructose Corn Syrup.Date of experience: March 01, 2023

tastes worse than the cheapest competitorBought an ''original taste'' bottle as it was on offer with some pizza. Placed in the fridge in the morning so it's cold enough for later in the evening. Poured in a glass and I instantly noticed a lack of carbonation because cocacola usually foams up a lot. It tasted nowhere near like I remember it. Instead it tasted about as flat as if I had left the bottle opened for 2-3 days, nowhere near the original fizz, just tasted like some old out of date vile thing.I never finished the glass, and it all went in the sink with me wondering if it was even safe to drink.Date of experience: February 20, 2024

Crazy, stupid new Lid debacleI am not sure what bright spark decides to make the lids unattachable on your bottles,  but it is literally the worst idea ever. It is nye on impossible to get the lid back on securely without leaks and if you do manage it, trying to close it tightly results in skin cuts from the jagged Lid attachments.  I don't know why you are trying to invent the wheel, it was not broken, so why try and fix it.  There was absolutely no issue with the detachable lids previously.  It is an extremely poor show and needs to revert to the original design asap. Crazy, useless invention that causes damage to the user and you are going to end up with claims for cuts and lacerations.  Time for a major rethink and putting right what was never wrongDate of experience: July 09, 2023

Wouldn't use any machinery from these lot we was sold a post mix machine back in 2021 and since then nothing but trouble.two major leaks that flooded the bar then we decided to turn the machine off and have it removed.The interesting thing when the machine was switched off is how much energy it added to our electricity billAfter switching it off our bills dropped ¬£170 a month!!!!!When we agreed to take the machine at no point was I told that it would add so much to our bills.So two days ago two lads come down to remove the machine but in the process damaged the water filter unit attached to the coffee machine , they said nothing and went on there way . it only came to light when the machine wouldn't work as no water going to it , I turned on the water and got soaked from the damaged filter .Todays update is nothing people are off nobody about to help and my coffee machine is still off losing me money .Think very carefully before buying any machinery from Coca Cola Date of experience: June 07, 2024

WellWell, you know how it is. You may like the product, or you might be staying away from it because of all the sugar and not-so-healthy and necessary things for your metabolism in the drink. but it is an inevitable fact that the coke is a household name in so many families across a vast majority of the countries in the world these days. It did not happen overnight obviously, but you know, it is like a tradition and a safe choice for a lot of people when it comes to soft drinks. I like to enjoy a light coke every now and then. It's that perfect combination of sweetness and the fizz that give you the tingling sensation when it goes down your throat.and It's not even the taste, it is about the adaptation, it is "familiar" so it has become like a comfort beverage for me. Especially with food when I now I cannot have any other beverage. It can also give you a short-time energy before the gym if you don't have access to a pre-work out at the moment, but don't take my word for it, i am not a personal trainer or a nutritionist haha :DDate of experience: January 26, 2024
